name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

match-rule-ig.description: Contains match rule information for Request Control.
match-rule-ig.title: Request Control

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Request Control is `igMatchRule`.

allowDeny.description: If set to `allow`, the request is sent to origin when all conditions are true. If `deny`, the request is denied when all conditions are true. If `denybranded`, the request is denied and rerouted according to the configuration of the [Request Control behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-request-control).

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Phased Release.
oneOf.title: Phased Release

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, and `percent`.

percent.description: The percentage of visitors directed to a different origin.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Forward Rewrite.
oneOf.title: Forward Rewrite

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Forward Rewrite is `frMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

passThroughPercent.description: The percentage of requests that pass through to the origin, with `100` indicating the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of -1 sends everyone to the waiting room.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Audience Segmentation.
oneOf.title: Audience Segmentation

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Audience Segmentation is `asMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Phased Release.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use this for more complex match criteria.

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

passThroughPercent.description: The range `0.000: 99.000` specifies the percentage of requests that pass through to the origin. The value of `100` means the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of `-1` means send everyone to the waiting room.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Request Control.
oneOf.title: Request Control

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Request Control is `igMatchRule`.

allowDeny.description: If set to `allow`, the request is sent to origin when all conditions are true. If `deny`, the request is denied when all conditions are true. If `denybranded`, the request is denied and rerouted according to the configuration of the [Request Control behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-request-control).

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Forward Rewrite.
oneOf.title: Forward Rewrite

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Forward Rewrite is `frMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

allowDeny.description: If set to `allow`, the request is sent to origin when all conditions are true. If `deny`, the request is denied when all conditions are true. useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

groupId.description: Identifies the group where the property is placed.

createDate.description: Date of the policy version creation in milliseconds.

createdBy.description: User name who created the policy version.

deleted.description: Flag determining whether the policy version is deleted or not.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Edge Redirector.
oneOf.title: Edge Redirector

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Forward Rewrite.
oneOf.title: Forward Rewrite

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Forward Rewrite is `frMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

activations.description: List of activations related to the policy version.

items.description: Returns details of a policy activation.

apiVersion.description: The specific version of this API.

network.description: The network, either `STAGING`, `PRODUCTION`, or `prod` as shorthand, on which a load balancing configuration for Application Load Balancer has been activated. Values are case-insensitive in requests.

policyInfo.description: Returns details of a policy associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

propertyInfo.description: Returns details of a property associated with policy activation.

activatedBy.description: User name who issued the activation.

activationDate.description: Date of the activation in milliseconds.

groupId.description: Identifies the group where the property is placed.

serviceVersion.description: __Deprecated__ __Deprecated__ The build of the software running on the server. The value can be `null`.

createDate.description: Date of the policy version creation in milliseconds.

createdBy.description: User name who created the policy version.

deleted.description: Flag determining whether the policy version is deleted or not.

lastModifiedBy.description: User name who recently modified the policy version.

lastModifiedDate.description: Date of the recent policy version modification in milliseconds.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

matchRules.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple`, `range`, and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on. Use `range` when the match is true for incoming requests within an inclusive range of two numbers.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.
oneOf.title: Range

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` or `range` match value subtypes, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Phased Release.
oneOf.title: Phased Release

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, and `percent`.

percent.description: The percentage of visitors directed to a different origin.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Application Load Balancer.
oneOf.title: Application Load Balancer

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Application Load Balancer is `albMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL. You can specify any of the following with this object: `originId`, `pathAndQS`, and `useIncomingQueryString`.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use this for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: When setting up a range match, enter the two numbers that comprise the range. If the value assigned to an incoming request falls within this inclusive range, the match is true. The specified `range` needs to be a percentage from 1 to 100.

value.description: An inclusive range comprised of two numbers to match on.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

matchesAlways.description: The match rule always applies when `true`. When `false`, the rule applies within the `start` and `end` time range.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Visitor Prioritization.
oneOf.title: Visitor Prioritization

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Visitor Prioritization is `vpMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

matchURL.description: The URL the Cloudlet uses to match the incoming request.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.
objectMatchValue.title: Object match value

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

passThroughPercent.description: The range `0.000: 99.000` specifies the percentage of requests that pass through to the origin. The value of `100` means the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of `-1` means send everyone to the waiting room.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the request's query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

policyId.description: ID of the policy the version is associated to.

rulesLocked.description: Flag determining whether the rules are locked or not.

post-policy-version-rules-response.description: Provides information on the new rule that was added to an existing policy version.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. Application Load Balancer is `albMatchRule`, API Prioritization is `apMatchRule`, Audience Segmentation is `asMatchRule`, Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`, Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`, Forward Rewrite is`frMatchRule`, Request Control is `igMatchRule`, and Visitor Prioritization is  `vpMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` for the rule. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

items.description: A list of Cloudlet-specific match rules for this policy.

redirectURL.description: The URL Edge Redirector redirects the request to. If using `useRelativeUrl`, you can enter a path for the value. If `useRelativeUrl` is not used or set to `none`, then the `redirectUrl` should be a fully qualified URL.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response redirect type status code: `301` for permanent redirect, `302` for temporary redirect, `303` for temporary using GET, `307` for temporary retain method, or `308` for permanent retain method.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

useIncomingSchemeAndHost.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet copies both the scheme and the hostname from the incoming request to use in the redirect URL.

useRelativeUrl.description: If set to `relative_url`, takes the path entered for the `redirectUrl` and sets it in the responses `Location` header. The client browser receiving the request decides which protocol and hostname to use. If set to `copy_scheme_hostname`, it creates an absolute path by taking the protocol and hostname from the incoming request and combining them with path information entered for the `redirectUrl`. This absolute path is set in the responses `Location` header. If you don't include `useRelativeUrl`, or if you set it to `none`, then specify the `redirectUrl` as a fully qualified URL.

oneOf.description: Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values.
oneOf.title: Simple

value.description: The `simple` array values for incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

oneOf.description: Use the `objectMatchValueObjectSubtype` for more complex match criteria.
oneOf.title: Object

name.description: If using a match type that supports `name` attributes, enter the value in the incoming request to match on. The following match types support this property: `cookie`, `header`, `parameter`, and `query`.

options.description: If using the `object` match value subtype, use this array to list the values to match on.

value.description: If using the `simple` match value subtype, enter the value attributes in the incoming request to match on. Valid entries vary by match type. For example, GET and POST are valid entries for the `method` match type.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` should be evaluated based on case sensitivity.

valueEscaped.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes escaped characters.

valueHasWildcard.description: Set to `true` if the entries for `value` includes wildcards.

nameCaseSensitive.description: When set to `true`, the `name` match is case-sensitive.

nameHasWildcard.description: When set to `true`, `name` matches can include `*` and `?` wildcards.

start.description: The start time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `start` is `0`, the match rule is on.

oneOf.description: Contains match rule information for Request Control.
oneOf.title: Request Control

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. For example, the string for Request Control is `igMatchRule`.

allowDeny.description: If set to `allow`, the request is sent to origin when all conditions are true. If `deny`, the request is denied when all conditions are true. If `denybranded`, the request is denied and rerouted according to the configuration of the [Request Control behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-request-control).

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When `end` is `0`, there is no end time for this match rule.

matches.description: The `matchType` and the `matchValue` or `objectMatchValue` used to conditionally pass through the request. Plus additional criteria to match on, like case sensitivity (`caseSensitive`).

caseSensitive.description: If `true`, the match is case sensitive.

checkIPs.description: For `clientip`, `continent`, `countrycode`, `proxy`, and `regioncode` match types, the part of the request that determines the IP address to use. Values include the connecting IP address (`CONNECTING_IP`) and the `X-Forwarded-For` header (`XFF_HEADERS`). To select both, enter the two values separated by a space delimiter. When you include both values, the connecting IP address evaluates first.

matchOperator.description: This checks the incoming request to see if it `contains` or `equals` the `matchValue`, or if the request `header` you want to match on `exists`. With the exception of `hostname`, when using a wildcard, you need to set `matchOperator` to `contains`. For `hostname`, you don't need `contains`. Asterisks (`*`) in the `hostname` behave as wildcards. For example, `*.example.com` can match many subdomains.

matchValue.description: The `matchValue` depends on the `matchType`. For example if the `matchType` is `hostname`, then `matchValue` is the fully qualified domain name, like `www.akamai.com`.

negate.description: Whether the match should be ignored (`negate` is `true`) or if the match should be acted on (`negate` is `false`).

objectMatchValue.description: The match rule value to match on. The object match value subtypes include `simple` and `object` arrays. Use `object` for more complex match criteria. Use the `simple` array option when adding an array of string-based values to match on.

passThroughPercent.description: The range `0.000: 99.000` specifies the percentage of requests that pass through to the origin. The value of `100` means the request always passes through to the origin. For Visitor Prioritization, a value of `-1` means send everyone to the waiting room.

get-policy-version-rule-response.description: Returns information about a specific rule within a policy version.

type.description: The type of Cloudlet the rule is for. Application Load Balancer is `albMatchRule`, API Prioritization is `apMatchRule`, Audience Segmentation is `asMatchRule`, Phased Release is `cdMatchRule`, Edge Redirector is `erMatchRule`, Forward Rewrite is`frMatchRule`, Request Control is `igMatchRule` and Visitor Prioritization is  `vpMatchRule`.

disabled.description: If `true`, disables a rule so it's not evaluated against incoming requests. The default setting is `false`.

end.description: The end time for this match rule in epoch seconds. When the rule is set to `matchAlways`, the `end` time displays as `0`.

forwardSettings.description: Defines data used to construct a new request URL. If all set conditions are true, the edge server returns an HTTP response from the rewritten URL.

pathAndQS.description: If a value is provided and match conditions are met, this is the URL path to rewrite the incoming request's URL. The URL may include additional query parameters.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center.

useIncomingQueryString.description: If set to `true`, the Cloudlet includes the requests' query string in the rewritten or forwarded URL.

location.description: The navigable endpoint used for the object referred to in the operation.
